intro: Hieracium alienatum, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands, meadows, and disturbed soils, and can reach heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium alienatum is often considered an invasive species in some regions due to its rapid spread and competitive growth.
